member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.EventId
member.summary: Identifies a logging event. The primary identifier is the "Id" property, with the "Name" property providing a short description of this type of event.

member.summary: Checks if two specified instances have the same value. They are equal if they have the same Id.

The second .
member.returns: true if the objects are equal.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.EventId.op_Inequality(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.EventId,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.EventId)
member.summary: Checks if two specified instances have different values.

The second .

member.summary: Gets the name of this event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.EventId.Equals(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.EventId)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current object is equal to another object of the same type. Two events are equal if they have the same id.
member.param: An object to compare with this object.
member.returns: true if the current object is equal to the other parameter; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.FormattedLogValues
member.summary: LogValues to enable formatting options supported by . This also enables using {NamedformatItem} in the format string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.IExternalScopeProvider
member.summary: Represents a storage of common scope data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.IExternalScopeProvider.ForEachScope``1(System.Action{System.Object,``0},``0)
member.summary: Executes callback for each currently active scope objects in order of creation. All callbacks are guaranteed to be called inline from this method.
member.param: The callback to be executed for every scope object
The state object to be passed into the callback
member.typeparam: The type of state to accept.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.IExternalScopeProvider.Push(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds scope object to the list
member.param: The scope object
member.returns: The token that removes scope on dispose.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LoggerExtensions.LogDebug(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.EventId,System.Exception,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Formats and writes a debug log message.

The event id associated with the log.
The exception to log.
Format string of the log message in message template format. Example: "User {User} logged in from {Address}"
An object array that contains zero or more objects to format.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel
member.summary: Defines logging severity levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel.Trace
member.summary: Logs that contain the most detailed messages. These messages may contain sensitive application data. These messages are disabled by default and should never be enabled in a production environment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: Logs that are used for interactive investigation during development. These logs should primarily contain information useful for debugging and have no long-term value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel.Information
member.summary: Logs that track the general flow of the application. These logs should have long-term value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: Logs that highlight an abnormal or unexpected event in the application flow, but do not otherwise cause the application execution to stop.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: Logs that highlight when the current flow of execution is stopped due to a failure. These should indicate a failure in the current activity, not an application-wide failure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel.Critical
member.summary: Logs that describe an unrecoverable application or system crash, or a catastrophic failure that requires immediate attention.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel.None
member.summary: Not used for writing log messages. Specifies that a logging category should not write any messages.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogValuesFormatter
member.summary: Formatter to convert the named format items like {NamedformatItem} to format.
